description:
What’s stronger, your arm muscles or your leg muscles? Exactly. This stirrup lets you reboard a righted kayak using your mighty quads instead of your tired biceps. It’s handy for fatigued paddlers, vital for people with limited upper body strength, and essential for anyone looking after others. Like any rescue gear, a stirrup is more likely to work if you practice with it before you need it.

  • Adaptable for paddlefloat self-rescues or boat-to-boat rescues
  • 14ft. of high-visibility nylon webbing, adjustable for a variety of attachment options
  • Security hook attaches stirrup under deck lines or into a PFD pocket
  • Neoprene wrap provides floatation
name: North Water Pro Rescue Stirrup
